Empire.description: [Empire](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0363) can use Inveigh to conduct name service poisoning for credential theft and associated relay attacks.(Citation: Github PowerShell Empire)(Citation: GitHub Inveigh)

Empire.name: Credential API Hooking
Empire.description: [Empire](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0363) contains some modules that leverage API hooking to carry out tasks, such as netripper.(Citation: Github PowerShell Empire)

Empire.name: Command and Scripting Interpreter
Empire.description: [Empire](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0363) uses a command-line interface to interact with systems.(Citation: Github PowerShell Empire)

Empire.name: PowerShell
Empire.description: [Empire](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0363) leverages PowerShell for the majority of its client-side agent tasks. [Empire](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0363) also contains the ability to conduct PowerShell remoting with the Invoke-PSRemoting module.(Citation: Github PowerShell Empire)(Citation: NCSC Joint Report Public Tools)

Empire.name: Service Execution
Empire.description: [Empire](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0363) can use [PsExec](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0029) to execute a payload on a remote host.(Citation: Github PowerShell Empire)

Empire.name: Distributed Component Object Model
Empire.description: [Empire](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0363) can utilize Invoke-DCOM to leverage remote COM execution for lateral movement.(Citation: Github PowerShell Empire)

Empire.name: Exploitation of Remote Services
Empire.description: [Empire](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0363) has a limited number of built-in modules for exploiting remote SMB, JBoss, and Jenkins servers.(Citation: Github PowerShell Empire)

Empire.name: Create Process with Token
Empire.description: [Empire](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0363) can use Invoke-RunAs to make tokens.(Citation: Github PowerShell Empire)

Empire.name: Pass the Hash
Empire.description: [Empire](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0363) can perform pass the hash attacks.(Citation: Github PowerShell Empire)

Empire.name: SSH
Empire.description: [Empire](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0363) contains modules for executing commands over SSH as well as in-memory VNC agent injection.(Citation: Github PowerShell Empire)

Empire.name: Scheduled Task
Empire.description: [Empire](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0363) has modules to interact with the Windows task scheduler.(Citation: Github PowerShell Empire)

Empire.name: Windows Management Instrumentation
Empire.description: [Empire](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0363) can use WMI to deliver a payload to a remote host.(Citation: Github PowerShell Empire)

Empire.name: Accessibility Features
Empire.description: [Empire](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0363) can leverage WMI debugging to remotely replace binaries like sethc.exe, Utilman.exe, and Magnify.exe with cmd.exe.(Citation: Github PowerShell Empire)

Empire.name: Network Service Scanning
Empire.description: [Empire](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0363) can perform port scans from an infected host.(Citation: Github PowerShell Empire)

Empire.name: DLL Search Order Hijacking
Empire.description: [Empire](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0363) contains modules that can discover and exploit various DLL hijacking opportunities.(Citation: Github PowerShell Empire)

Empire.name: Windows Service
Empire.description: [Empire](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0363) can utilize built-in modules to modify service binaries and restore them to their original state.(Citation: Github PowerShell Empire)

Empire.name: Exploitation for Privilege Escalation
Empire.description: [Empire](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0363) can exploit vulnerabilities such as MS16-032 and MS16-135.(Citation: Github PowerShell Empire)

Empire.name: Security Support Provider
Empire.description: [Empire](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0363) can enumerate Security Support Providers (SSPs) as well as utilize [PowerSploit](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0194)'s Install-SSP and Invoke-Mimikatz to install malicious SSPs and log authentication events.(Citation: Github PowerShell Empire)

Empire.name: Bypass User Access Control
Empire.description: [Empire](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0363) includes various modules to attempt to bypass UAC for escalation of privileges.(Citation: Github PowerShell Empire)

Empire.name: SID-History Injection
Empire.description: [Empire](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0363) can add a SID-History to a user if on a domain controller.(Citation: Github PowerShell Empire)

Empire.name: Shortcut Modification
Empire.description: [Empire](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0363) can persist by modifying a .LNK file to include a backdoor.(Citation: Github PowerShell Empire)

Empire.name: Local Account
Empire.description: [Empire](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0363) has a module for creating a local user if permissions allow.(Citation: Github PowerShell Empire)

Empire.name: Archive Collected Data
Empire.description: [Empire](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0363) can ZIP directories on the target system.(Citation: Github PowerShell Empire)

Empire.name: Local Email Collection
Empire.description: [Empire](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0363) has the ability to collect emails on a target system.(Citation: Github PowerShell Empire)

Empire.name: Timestomp
Empire.description: [Empire](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0363) can timestomp any files or payloads placed on a target machine to help them blend in.(Citation: Github PowerShell Empire)

Empire.name: Registry Run Keys / Startup Folder
Empire.description: [Empire](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0363) can modify the registry run keys HKEY_CURRENT_USER\Software\Microsoft\Windows\CurrentVersion\Run and HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\Software\Microsoft\Windows\CurrentVersion\Run for persistence.(Citation: Github PowerShell Empire)

Empire.name: Domain Account
Empire.description: [Empire](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0363) can acquire local and domain user account information.(Citation: Github PowerShell Empire)

Empire.name: Web Protocols
Empire.description: [Empire](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0363) can conduct command and control over protocols like HTTP and HTTPS.(Citation: Github PowerShell Empire)

Empire.name: Commonly Used Port
Empire.description: [Empire](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0363) can conduct command and control over commonly used ports like 80 and 443.(Citation: Github PowerShell Empire)

Empire.name: Exfiltration to Cloud Storage
Empire.description: [Empire](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0363) can use Dropbox for data exfiltration.(Citation: Github PowerShell Empire)

Empire.name: Exfiltration Over C2 Channel
Empire.description: [Empire](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0363) can send data gathered from a target through the command and control channel.(Citation: Github PowerShell Empire)

Empire.name: Network Share Discovery
Empire.description: [Empire](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0363) can find shared drives on the local system.(Citation: Github PowerShell Empire)

Empire.name: Process Discovery
Empire.description: [Empire](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0363) can find information about processes running on local and remote systems.(Citation: Github PowerShell Empire)

Empire.name: System Network Connections Discovery
Empire.description: [Empire](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0363) can enumerate the current network connections of a host.(Citation: Github PowerShell Empire)

Empire.name: System Network Configuration Discovery
Empire.description: [Empire](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0363) can acquire network configuration information like DNS servers and network proxies used by a host.(Citation: Github PowerShell Empire)

Empire.name: System Information Discovery
Empire.description: [Empire](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0363) can enumerate host system information like OS, architecture, applied patches, and more.(Citation: Github PowerShell Empire)

Empire.name: Security Software Discovery
Empire.description: [Empire](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0363) can enumerate antivirus software on the target.(Citation: Github PowerShell Empire)

Empire.name: Asymmetric Cryptography
Empire.description: [Empire](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0363) can use TLS to encrypt its C2 channel.(Citation: Github PowerShell Empire)

Empire.name: Ingress Tool Transfer
Empire.description: [Empire](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0363) can upload and download to and from a victim machine.(Citation: Github PowerShell Empire)

Empire.name: Native API
Empire.description: [Empire](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0363) contains a variety of enumeration modules that have an option to use API calls to carry out tasks.(Citation: Github PowerShell Empire)

Empire.name: Obfuscated Files or Information
Empire.description: [Empire](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0363) has the ability to obfuscate commands using Invoke-Obfuscation.(Citation: Github PowerShell Empire)

Empire.name: Group Policy Modification
Empire.description: [Empire](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0363) can use New-GPOImmediateTask to modify a GPO that will install and execute a malicious [Scheduled Task/Job](https://attack.mitre.org/techniques/T1053).(Citation: Github PowerShell Empire)

Empire.name: Bidirectional Communication
Empire.description: [Empire](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0363) can use Dropbox and GitHub for C2.(Citation: Github PowerShell Empire)

Empire.name: Domain Trust Discovery
Empire.description: [Empire](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0363) has modules for enumerating domain trusts.(Citation: Github PowerShell Empire)

Empire.name: Credentials from Web Browsers
Empire.description: [Empire](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0363) can use modules that extract passwords from common web browsers such as Firefox and Chrome.(Citation: Github PowerShell Empire)

Empire.name: Domain Account
Empire.description: [Empire](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0363) has a module for creating a new domain user if permissions allow.(Citation: Github PowerShell Empire)

Empire.name: Exfiltration to Code Repository
Empire.description: [Empire](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0363) can use GitHub for data exfiltration.(Citation: Github PowerShell Empire)

Empire.name: Access Token Manipulation
Empire.description: [Empire](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0363) can use [PowerSploit](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0194)'s Invoke-TokenManipulation to manipulate access tokens.(Citation: Github PowerShell Empire)

Empire.name: Silver Ticket
Empire.description: [Empire](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0363) can leverage its implementation of [Mimikatz](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0002) to obtain and use silver tickets.(Citation: Github PowerShell Empire)

Empire.name: Local Account
Empire.description: [Empire](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0363) can acquire local and domain user account information.(Citation: Github PowerShell Empire)

Empire.name: Path Interception by PATH Environment Variable
Empire.description: [Empire](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0363) contains modules that can discover and exploit path interception opportunities in the PATH environment variable.(Citation: Github PowerShell Empire)

Empire.name: Path Interception by Search Order Hijacking
Empire.description: [Empire](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0363) contains modules that can discover and exploit search order hijacking vulnerabilities.(Citation: Github PowerShell Empire)

Empire.name: Path Interception by Unquoted Path
Empire.description: [Empire](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0363) contains modules that can discover and exploit unquoted path vulnerabilities.(Citation: Github PowerShell Empire)

Empire.name: MSBuild
Empire.description: [Empire](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0363) can use built-in modules to abuse trusted utilities like MSBuild.exe.(Citation: Github PowerShell Empire)

RawDisk.name: Disk Structure Wipe
RawDisk.description: [RawDisk](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0364) was used in [Shamoon](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0140) to help overwrite components of disk structure like the MBR and disk partitions.(Citation: Palo Alto Shamoon Nov 2016)(Citation: Unit 42 Shamoon3 2018)

RawDisk.name: Data Destruction
RawDisk.description: [RawDisk](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0364) was used in [Shamoon](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0140) to write to protected system locations such as the MBR and disk partitions in an effort to destroy data.(Citation: Palo Alto Shamoon Nov 2016)(Citation: Unit 42 Shamoon3 2018)

RawDisk.name: Disk Content Wipe
RawDisk.description: [RawDisk](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0364) has been used to directly access the hard disk to help overwrite arbitrarily sized portions of disk content.(Citation: Novetta Blockbuster Destructive Malware)

PoshC2.name: Brute Force
PoshC2.description: [PoshC2](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0378) has modules for brute forcing local administrator and AD user accounts.(Citation: GitHub PoshC2)

PoshC2.name: Domain Trust Discovery
PoshC2.description: [PoshC2](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0378) has modules for enumerating domain trusts.(Citation: GitHub PoshC2)

PoshC2.name: LLMNR/NBT-NS Poisoning and SMB Relay

PoshC2.name: Bypass User Access Control

PoshC2.description: [PoshC2](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0378) has modules for keystroke logging and capturing credentials from spoofed Outlook authentication messages.(Citation: GitHub PoshC2)

PoshC2.description: [PoshC2](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0378) contains modules for local privilege escalation exploits such as CVE-2016-9192 and CVE-2016-0099.(Citation: GitHub PoshC2)

PoshC2.description: [PoshC2](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0378) contains multiple modules for injecting into processes, such as Invoke-PSInject.(Citation: GitHub PoshC2)

PoshC2.description: [PoshC2](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0378) can use Invoke-RunAs to make tokens.(Citation: GitHub PoshC2)

PoshC2.name: Pass the Hash
PoshC2.description: [PoshC2](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0378) has a number of modules that leverage pass the hash for lateral movement.(Citation: GitHub PoshC2)

PoshC2.name: Proxy
PoshC2.description: [PoshC2](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0378) contains modules that allow for use of proxies in command and control.(Citation: GitHub PoshC2)

PoshC2.name: Windows Management Instrumentation Event Subscription
PoshC2.description: [PoshC2](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0378) has the ability to persist on a system using WMI events.(Citation: GitHub PoshC2)

PoshC2.name: Windows Management Instrumentation
PoshC2.description: [PoshC2](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0378) has a number of modules that use WMI to execute tasks.(Citation: GitHub PoshC2)

PoshC2.name: LSASS Memory
PoshC2.description: [PoshC2](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0378) contains an implementation of [Mimikatz](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0002) to gather credentials from memory.(Citation: GitHub PoshC2)

PoshC2.name: Credentials In Files
PoshC2.description: [PoshC2](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0378) contains modules for searching for passwords in local and remote files.(Citation: GitHub PoshC2)

PoshC2.name: Archive via Utility
PoshC2.description: [PoshC2](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0378) contains a module for compressing data using ZIP.(Citation: GitHub PoshC2)

PoshC2.name: Service Execution
PoshC2.description: [PoshC2](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0378) contains an implementation of [PsExec](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0029) for remote execution.(Citation: GitHub PoshC2)

PoshC2.description: [PoshC2](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0378) can enumerate service and service permission information.(Citation: GitHub PoshC2)

PoshC2.name: System Network Connections Discovery
PoshC2.description: [PoshC2](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0378) contains an implementation of [netstat](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0104) to enumerate TCP and UDP connections.(Citation: GitHub PoshC2)

PoshC2.name: System Network Configuration Discovery
PoshC2.description: [PoshC2](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0378) can enumerate network adapter information.(Citation: GitHub PoshC2)

PoshC2.name: System Information Discovery
PoshC2.description: [PoshC2](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0378) contains modules, such as Get-ComputerInfo, for enumerating common system information.(Citation: GitHub PoshC2)

PoshC2.name: Local Groups
PoshC2.description: [PoshC2](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0378) contains modules, such as Get-LocAdm for enumerating permission groups.(Citation: GitHub PoshC2)

PoshC2.name: Password Policy Discovery
PoshC2.description: [PoshC2](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0378) can use Get-PassPol to enumerate the domain password policy.(Citation: GitHub PoshC2)

PoshC2.name: Network Service Scanning
PoshC2.description: [PoshC2](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0378) can perform port scans from an infected host.(Citation: GitHub PoshC2)

PoshC2.name: Network Sniffing
PoshC2.description: [PoshC2](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0378) contains a module for taking packet captures on compromised hosts.(Citation: GitHub PoshC2)

PoshC2.name: Domain Account
PoshC2.description: [PoshC2](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0378) can enumerate local and domain user account information.(Citation: GitHub PoshC2)

PoshC2.name: File and Directory Discovery
PoshC2.description: [PoshC2](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0378) can enumerate files on the local file system and includes a module for enumerating recently accessed files.(Citation: GitHub PoshC2)

PoshC2.name: Web Protocols
PoshC2.description: [PoshC2](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0378) can use protocols like HTTP/HTTPS for command and control traffic.(Citation: GitHub PoshC2)

PoshC2.name: Access Token Manipulation
PoshC2.description: [PoshC2](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0378) can use Invoke-TokenManipulation for manipulating tokens.(Citation: GitHub PoshC2)

PoshC2.name: Local Account
PoshC2.description: [PoshC2](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0378) can enumerate local and domain user account information.(Citation: GitHub PoshC2)

esentutl.name: Ingress Tool Transfer
esentutl.description: [esentutl](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0404) can be used to copy files to/from a given URL.(Citation: LOLBAS Esentutl)

esentutl.name: NTFS File Attributes
esentutl.description: [esentutl](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0404) can be used to read and write alternate data streams.(Citation: LOLBAS Esentutl)

esentutl.name: NTDS
esentutl.description: [esentutl](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0404) can use Volume Shadow Copy to copy locked files such as ntds.dit.(Citation: LOLBAS Esentutl)(Citation: Cary Esentutl)

esentutl.name: Lateral Tool Transfer
esentutl.description: [esentutl](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0404) can be used to copy files to/from a remote share.(Citation: LOLBAS Esentutl)

MailSniper.name: Password Spraying
MailSniper.description: [MailSniper](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0413) can be used for password spraying against Exchange and Office 365.(Citation: GitHub MailSniper)

MailSniper.name: Remote Email Collection
MailSniper.description: [MailSniper](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0413) can be used for searching through email in Exchange and Office 365 environments.(Citation: GitHub MailSniper)

MailSniper.name: Email Account
MailSniper.description: [MailSniper](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0413) can be used to obtain account names from Exchange and Office 365 using the Get-GlobalAddressList cmdlet.(Citation: Black Hills Attacking Exchange MailSniper, 2016)

Imminent Monitor.name: Keylogging
Imminent Monitor.description: [Imminent Monitor](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0434) has a keylogging module.(Citation: Imminent Unit42 Dec2019)

Imminent Monitor.name: Hidden Files and Directories
Imminent Monitor.description: [Imminent Monitor](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0434) has a dynamic debugging feature to set the file attribute to hidden.(Citation: QiAnXin APT-C-36 Feb2019)

Imminent Monitor.name: File and Directory Discovery
Imminent Monitor.description: [Imminent Monitor](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0434) has a dynamic debugging feature to check whether it is located in the %TEMP% directory, otherwise it copies itself there.(Citation: QiAnXin APT-C-36 Feb2019)

Imminent Monitor.name: Remote Desktop Protocol
Imminent Monitor.description: [Imminent Monitor](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0434) has a module for performing remote desktop access.(Citation: QiAnXin APT-C-36 Feb2019)

Imminent Monitor.name: Resource Hijacking
Imminent Monitor.description: [Imminent Monitor](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0434) has the capability to run a cryptocurrency miner on the victim machine.(Citation: Imminent Unit42 Dec2019)

Imminent Monitor.name: Process Discovery
Imminent Monitor.description: [Imminent Monitor](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0434) has a "Process Watcher" feature to monitor processes in case the client ever crashes or gets closed.(Citation: Imminent Unit42 Dec2019)

Imminent Monitor.name: Video Capture
Imminent Monitor.description: [Imminent Monitor](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0434) has a remote webcam monitoring capability.(Citation: Imminent Unit42 Dec2019)(Citation: QiAnXin APT-C-36 Feb2019)

Imminent Monitor.name: Audio Capture
Imminent Monitor.description: [Imminent Monitor](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0434) has a remote microphone monitoring capability.(Citation: Imminent Unit42 Dec2019)(Citation: QiAnXin APT-C-36 Feb2019)

Imminent Monitor.name: Exfiltration Over C2 Channel
Imminent Monitor.description: [Imminent Monitor](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0434) has uploaded a file containing debugger logs, network information and system information to the C2.(Citation: QiAnXin APT-C-36 Feb2019)

Imminent Monitor.name: Obfuscated Files or Information
Imminent Monitor.description: [Imminent Monitor](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0434) has encrypted the spearphish attachments to avoid detection from email gateways; the debugger also encrypts information before sending to the C2.(Citation: QiAnXin APT-C-36 Feb2019)

Imminent Monitor.name: Disable or Modify Tools
Imminent Monitor.description: [Imminent Monitor](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0434) has a feature to disable Windows Task Manager.(Citation: Imminent Unit42 Dec2019)

Imminent Monitor.name: Native API
Imminent Monitor.description: [Imminent Monitor](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0434) has leveraged CreateProcessW() call to execute the debugger.(Citation: QiAnXin APT-C-36 Feb2019)

Imminent Monitor.name: File Deletion
Imminent Monitor.description: [Imminent Monitor](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0434) has deleted files related to its dynamic debugger feature.(Citation: QiAnXin APT-C-36 Feb2019)

Imminent Monitor.name: Command and Scripting Interpreter
Imminent Monitor.description: [Imminent Monitor](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0434) has a CommandPromptPacket and ScriptPacket module(s) for creating a remote shell and executing scripts.(Citation: QiAnXin APT-C-36 Feb2019)

Imminent Monitor.name: Deobfuscate/Decode Files or Information
Imminent Monitor.description: [Imminent Monitor](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0434) has decoded malware components that are then dropped to the system.(Citation: QiAnXin APT-C-36 Feb2019)

Imminent Monitor.name: Credentials from Web Browsers
Imminent Monitor.description: [Imminent Monitor](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0434) has a PasswordRecoveryPacket module for recovering browser passwords.(Citation: QiAnXin APT-C-36 Feb2019)

ShimRatReporter.name: Obfuscated Files or Information
ShimRatReporter.description: [ShimRatReporter](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0445) encrypted gathered information with a combination of shifting and XOR using a static key.(Citation: FOX-IT May 2016 Mofang)

ShimRatReporter.name: Account Discovery
ShimRatReporter.description: [ShimRatReporter](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0445) listed all non-privileged and privileged accounts available on the machine.(Citation: FOX-IT May 2016 Mofang)

ShimRatReporter.name: Process Discovery
ShimRatReporter.description: [ShimRatReporter](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0445) listed all running processes on the machine.(Citation: FOX-IT May 2016 Mofang)

ShimRatReporter.name: System Information Discovery
ShimRatReporter.description: [ShimRatReporter](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0445) gathered the operating system name and specific Windows version of an infected machine.(Citation: FOX-IT May 2016 Mofang)

ShimRatReporter.name: Web Protocols
ShimRatReporter.description: [ShimRatReporter](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0445) communicated over HTTP with preconfigured C2 servers.(Citation: FOX-IT May 2016 Mofang)

ShimRatReporter.name: Ingress Tool Transfer
ShimRatReporter.description: [ShimRatReporter](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0445) had the ability to download additional payloads.(Citation: FOX-IT May 2016 Mofang)

ShimRatReporter.name: Match Legitimate Name or Location
ShimRatReporter.description: [ShimRatReporter](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0445) spoofed itself as AlphaZawgyl_font.exe, a specialized Unicode font.(Citation: FOX-IT May 2016 Mofang)

ShimRatReporter.name: Automated Exfiltration
ShimRatReporter.description: [ShimRatReporter](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0445) sent collected system and network information compiled into a report to an adversary-controlled C2.(Citation: FOX-IT May 2016 Mofang)

ShimRatReporter.name: Automated Collection
ShimRatReporter.description: [ShimRatReporter](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0445) gathered information automatically, without instruction from a C2, related to the user and host machine that is compiled into a report and sent to the operators.(Citation: FOX-IT May 2016 Mofang)

ShimRatReporter.name: Permission Groups Discovery
ShimRatReporter.description: [ShimRatReporter](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0445) gathered the local privileges for the infected host.(Citation: FOX-IT May 2016 Mofang)

ShimRatReporter.name: System Network Configuration Discovery
ShimRatReporter.description: [ShimRatReporter](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0445) gathered the local proxy, domain, IP, routing tables, mac address, gateway, DNS servers, and DHCP status information from an infected host.(Citation: FOX-IT May 2016 Mofang)

ShimRatReporter.name: Software Discovery
ShimRatReporter.description: [ShimRatReporter](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0445) gathered a list of installed software on the infected host.(Citation: FOX-IT May 2016 Mofang)

ShimRatReporter.name: Archive Collected Data
ShimRatReporter.description: [ShimRatReporter](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0445) used LZ compression to compress initial reconnaissance reports before sending to the C2.(Citation: FOX-IT May 2016 Mofang)

ShimRatReporter.name: System Network Connections Discovery
ShimRatReporter.description: [ShimRatReporter](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0445) used the Windows function GetExtendedUdpTable to detect connected UDP endpoints.(Citation: FOX-IT May 2016 Mofang)

ShimRatReporter.name: Native API
ShimRatReporter.description: [ShimRatReporter](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0445) used several Windows API functions to gather information from the infected system.(Citation: FOX-IT May 2016 Mofang)

ShimRatReporter.name: Exfiltration Over C2 Channel
ShimRatReporter.description: [ShimRatReporter](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0445) sent generated reports to the C2 via HTTP POST requests.(Citation: FOX-IT May 2016 Mofang)

CARROTBALL.name: File Transfer Protocols
CARROTBALL.description: [CARROTBALL](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0465) has the ability to use FTP in C2 communications.(Citation: Unit 42 CARROTBAT January 2020)

CARROTBALL.name: Ingress Tool Transfer
CARROTBALL.description: [CARROTBALL](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0465) has the ability to download and install a remote payload.(Citation: Unit 42 CARROTBAT January 2020)

CARROTBALL.name: Malicious File
CARROTBALL.description: [CARROTBALL](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0465) has been executed through users being lured into opening malicious e-mail attachments.(Citation: Unit 42 CARROTBAT January 2020)

CARROTBALL.name: Obfuscated Files or Information
CARROTBALL.description: [CARROTBALL](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0465) has used a custom base64 alphabet to decode files.(Citation: Unit 42 CARROTBAT January 2020)
